page.title: 15FARMING IN CHELMONDISTON
page.content: We have 350 acres on our farm and three people help my Dad to work it. Sometimes I help too. We grow wheat, barley, potatoes and sugar-beet. We sow the corn and potatoes in Spring and harvest the corn in July and the potatoes throughout the Summer. We sell potatoes and eggs at the farm. This year we did not get as much money for our potatoes as we usually do. At Christmas, we sell geese and poultry. Grandma looks after the ducks and geese We have two old pig buildings and we are building two more. We get them as weaners of about six weeks old. We feed them on pig nuts and when they are big enough, we send them to market.We give them straw to lie on. We bale the straw after we have combined the corn. The small bales we store in a barn and the round bales are kept out-side.
